description: Strategic Eco-systems and Biodiversity protected through the implementation of valuation methodologies, payment of environmental services and adoption of new technologies.

subproject.description: The Regional Report will focus on presenting concrete financial and economic benefits and costs to countries of sustainable ecosystem management.  The Report will look at the contribution of biodiversity and ecosystems to sectoral production and outputs to determine their economic value and role in promoting growth and equity. It will produce a report with sufficiently valuable and robust data to inform policy and decision makers in Latin America and the Caribbean of the need to invest and maintain biodiversity and ecosystem services. The project will also develop a methodological guidance for decision makers to compare through different scenarios the economic cost and profitability of business as usual or unsustainable practices, versus sustainable environmental management approaches within different economic activities. This will allow for decision makers to, for example, contrast the long term cost (considering externalities) of conventional commodity production versus the long term economic gain (considering  the ecosystem services provision) of agroforestry approaches to the production of the same commodity. This will help decision makers sell the business case for ecosystem functionality maintenance within public and private sectors alike.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: ECONOMIC VALUE OF BIODIVERSITY

subproject.description: The Protected Area Financing Initiative aims to ensure the effective channeling of resources and capacity building efforts to strategic actions for reduction of the financial gaps of protected areas system in LAC.  This will be achieved by equipping government and key decision makers in the region with the knowledge and tools necessary for developing financial framework to ensure long term sustainability of the national PA system.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: PA FINANCING STRATEGIES

subproject.description: The initiative aims to support, promote and strengthen REDD+ activities in Latin America and the Caribbean and stakeholder engagement in REDD+ readiness efforts, in coordination with UN-REDD, FCPF and other REDD+ readiness initiatives.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: REDD
